thread.title: New telecommunications start-up TelcoQ Ltd incorporates in Manchester, UK
thread.title_full: New telecommunications start-up TelcoQ Ltd incorporates in Manchester, UK

author: prbuzz.com
title: New telecommunications start-up TelcoQ Ltd incorporates in Manchester, UK
text:
Manchester, UK, 10th September 2015 - TelcoQ Ltd., the parent company of the TelcoQ, Rotten WiFi and WiFi Rank brands, has incorporated in the UK and established headquarters at Manchester's MediaCityUK development. The company - which originated as a telecoms start-up in Lithuania - is aiming to expand its domestic and international presence from its state-of-the-art base in the north-west of England.
TelcoQ Ltd. will operate from The Landing on Salford Quays. The development offers a home to ambitious, creative start-ups such as TelcoQ Ltd., as well as larger technology and media firms which are more firmly established in the market. As well as laboratory and studio services, fully supported by next-generation connectivity, The Landing offers a variety of high-quality managed workspaces.
With super-fast WiFi, 3G and 4G mobile broadband at its disposal, TelcoQ Ltd. sees The Landing as being the ideal base for its growing business. From its new Manchester home, the company will look to increase the profile of its rottenwifi.com, wifirank.com and telcoq.com testing and ranking websites. The city's business-grade connectivity, excellent communication links and enterprise-focused local economy are seen as being major assets to TelcoQ and its brands going forwards.
Arturas Jonkus, Co-founder of TelcoQ Ltd., commented: "We are happy to incorporate in MediaCityUK, which is a very lively and growing technology hub. We find the development very attractive in terms of cost, infrastructure and support from municipal agencies, such as MIDAS. It is the ideal place to locate our business."
About TelcoQ Ltd.'s brands
Rotten WiFi (http://rottenwifi.com/) is TelcoQ Ltd.'s 'Public WiFi and 3G/4G Watchdog'. The website is a crowdsourcing platform, which enables online users to assess the quality of WiFi connections. It can be used to test and evaluate signal quality, allowing users to share knowledge of the best and worst public WiFi spots.
WiFi Rank (http://wifirank.com/) is an online rating platform, which allows users to check the quality of WiFi connections at hotels around the world. They can compare average upload and download speeds, to identify the top performing accommodation providers in terms of connectivity. The service is set to be rolled out across the hospitality sector to include restaurants and cafes in the future.
TelcoQ (http://telcoq.com/) is a business-to-business (B2B) solution, allowing mobile telecommunications operators to monitor the quality of their 3G and 4G coverage online. Mobile service providers can check their networks from an end-user perspective, to flag up any potential connectivity issues and bolster WiFi and mobile broadband performance.
For more information:
Arturas Jonkus
Co-Founder
